column2: description
column3: symptoms
column4: treatment
column5: prevention
column6: when_to__see_doctor

column2: Skin condition when hair follicles plug with oil and dead skin cells
column3: Whiteheads, blackheads, papules, pustules, nodules, cysts
column4: Topical retinoids, antibiotics, benzoyl peroxide, oral contraceptives, isotretinoin
column5: Gentle cleansing, avoid oily products, don't pick at skin
column6: Severe cystic acne, scarring, emotional distress, treatment failure

column2: Rhinitis
column3: Allergic response causing nasal inflammation due to allergens
column4: Sneezing, runny nose, itchy eyes/nose/throat, nasal congestion, postnasal drip
column5: Antihistamines, nasal corticosteroids, decongestants, leukotriene modifiers, immunotherapy
column6: Avoid allergens, use air purifiers, keep windows closed during high pollen seasons
column7: Symptoms interfere with sleep or daily activities, OTC medications ineffective

column2: Condition with inadequate healthy red blood cells to carry sufficient oxygen
column3: Fatigue, weakness, pale skin, shortness of breath, dizziness, cold hands/feet, chest pain
column4: Iron supplements, vitamin B12 injections, folic acid, blood transfusion, treat underlying cause
column5: Iron-rich diet, treat underlying causes, regular check-ups
column6: Severe fatigue, chest pain, rapid heartbeat, fainting

column2: Anxiety
column3: Disorder
column4: Mental health disorder characterized by persistent and excessive worry
column5: Restlessness, fatigue, difficulty concentrating, irritability, muscle tension, sleep disturbances
column6: Cognitive behavioral therapy, SSRIs, SNRIs, benzodiazepines, buspirone
column7: Stress management, regular exercise, avoid caffeine, mindfulness meditation
column8: Panic attacks, suicidal thoughts, unable to perform daily activities

column2: Inflammation of the appendix requiring emergency medical attention
column3: Abdominal pain migrating to lower right quadrant, nausea, vomiting, fever, loss of appetite
column4: Appendectomy (surgical removal), antibiotics
column5: No known prevention
column6: Severe abdominal pain, fever, vomiting - REQUIRES IMMEDIATE EMERGENCY CARE

column2: Degenerative joint disease involving breakdown of joint cartilage
column3: Joint pain, stiffness, swelling, decreased range of motion, bone spurs
column4: NSAIDs, acetaminophen, physical therapy, joint injections, joint replacement
column5: Maintain healthy weight, exercise, avoid joint injury
column6: Severe joint pain, deformity, inability to move joint

column2: Chronic inflammatory disease of the airways causing reversible airflow obstruction
column3: Wheezing, coughing, chest tightness, shortness of breath, particularly at night/early morning
column4: Inhaled corticosteroids, bronchodilators, leukotriene modifiers, biologic therapies
column5: Avoid triggers (allergens, smoke), action plan, vaccinations
column6: Severe attack, bluish lips/nails, difficulty speaking

column2: Foot
column3: Fungal infection of the feet typically starting between toes
column4: Itching, burning, stinging, blisters, cracking, peeling skin, discolored toenails
column5: Antifungal creams (clotrimazole, miconazole), powders, oral medications (terbinafine)
column6: Keep feet dry, wear shower shoes, change socks daily, alternate shoes
column7: Severe infection, spreading to other areas, diabetes present

column2: Chronic medical condition with elevated blood pressure in the arteries
column3: Often asymptomatic; severe cases: headaches, shortness of breath, nosebleeds, flushing
column4: Lifestyle modifications, diuretics, ACE inhibitors, calcium channel blockers, beta-blockers
column5: Healthy diet (DASH), regular exercise, weight management, limit alcohol, no smoking
column6: BP >180/120, chest pain, shortness of breath, severe headache

column3: Diabetes
column4: Metabolic disorder characterized by high blood sugar, insulin resistance
column5: Increased thirst, frequent urination, hunger, fatigue, blurred vision, slow healing
column6: Metformin, sulfonylureas, insulin, SGLT2 inhibitors, GLP-1 receptor agonists
column7: Healthy diet, regular exercise, weight management, regular screening if high risk
column8: Blood sugar >300 mg/dL, ketones in urine, confusion, excessive thirst/urination

column2: Neurological condition characterized by recurrent, often debilitating headaches
column3: Throbbing pain, usually one-sided, sensitivity to light/sound, nausea, vomiting, aura
column4: Triptans, NSAIDs, antiemetics, preventive medications (beta-blockers, anticonvulsants)
column5: Identify and avoid triggers, stress management, regular sleep, hydration
column6: Sudden severe headache, headache with fever/stiff neck, neurological symptoms

column2: Mental health disorder characterized by persistent depressed mood
column3: Sadness, hopelessness, loss of interest, sleep/appite changes, fatigue, difficulty concentrating
column4: Antidepressants (SSRIs, SNRIs), psychotherapy (CBT), ECT for severe cases
column5: Regular exercise, social support, stress management, early treatment
column6: Suicidal thoughts, inability to function, psychotic symptoms

column2: Acute viral respiratory infection that can cause mild to severe illness
column3: Fever, chills, cough, sore throat, muscle aches, fatigue, headache
column4: Antiviral medications (oseltamivir, zanamivir), rest, fluids, pain relievers
column5: Annual flu vaccine, hand hygiene, avoid sick people
column6: Difficulty breathing, chest pain, confusion, severe vomiting

column2: Chronic condition where stomach acid frequently flows back into the esophagus
column3: Heartburn, regurgitation, chest pain, difficulty swallowing, chronic cough, laryngitis
column4: Proton pump inhibitors, H2 blockers, antacids, lifestyle modifications, surgery
column5: Avoid trigger foods, weight management, elevate head of bed, don't lie down after eating
column6: Severe chest pain, difficulty swallowing, unintentional weight loss

column2: Progressive lung disease causing obstructed airflow from the lungs
column3: Shortness of breath, wheezing, chest tightness, chronic cough with mucus, frequent respiratory infections
column4: Bronchodilators, inhaled steroids, oxygen therapy, pulmonary rehabilitation, antibiotics
column5: Smoking cessation, avoid pollutants, vaccinations
column6: Increased shortness of breath, bluish lips/nails, confusion

column2: Condition where thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone
column3: Fatigue, weight gain, cold intolerance, constipation, dry skin, depression, muscle weakness
column4: Levothyroxine (thyroid hormone replacement)
column5: No known prevention; regular monitoring if at risk
column6: Severe symptoms, heart rate <60 bpm, extreme fatigue

column2: Infection in any part of urinary system - kidneys, ureters, bladder, urethra
column3: Burning with urination, frequent urination, cloudy/strong-smelling urine, pelvic pain
column4: Antibiotics (trimethoprim-sulfa, nitrofurantoin), pain relievers, increased fluids
column5: Stay hydrated, wipe front to back, urinate after intercourse, avoid irritating feminine products
column6: Fever, chills, back pain (kidney infection), persistent symptoms

column2: Artery
column3: Disease
column4: Damage to heart's major blood vessels, usually from atherosclerosis
column5: Chest pain (angina), shortness of breath, heart attack, fatigue, dizziness
column6: Lifestyle changes, medications (statins, beta-blockers, aspirin), angioplasty, bypass surgery
column7: Healthy diet, regular exercise, no smoking, control blood pressure/cholesterol/diabetes
column8: Chest pain, especially with exertion; symptoms of heart attack

column2: Chronic autoimmune condition that causes rapid skin cell buildup
column3: Red patches with silvery scales, dry cracked skin, itching/burning, thickened pitted nails
column4: Topical corticosteroids, vitamin D analogs, phototherapy, systemic medications, biologics
column5: Stress management, avoid triggers, skin care, healthy lifestyle
column6: Widespread involvement, joint pain, significant impact on quality of life

column2: Arthritis
column3: Chronic inflammatory autoimmune disorder affecting joints
column4: Joint pain/swelling/stiffness (typically symmetrical), fatigue, fever, weight loss
column5: DMARDs, biologics, NSAIDs, corticosteroids, physical therapy
column6: No known prevention; early treatment may prevent joint damage
column7: Morning stiffness >30 minutes, joint swelling, multiple joint involvement

column2: Inflammation or infection of the transparent membrane lining eyelid
column3: Redness, itching, tearing, discharge, gritty feeling, crusting of eyelids
column4: Antibiotic drops (bacterial), antihistamines (allergic), artificial tears, cool compresses
column5: Hand hygiene, avoid touching eyes, don't share towels/makeup, replace contact lens case
column6: Severe pain, vision changes, sensitivity to light, symptoms worsening

column2: Inflammation or infection of small pouches (diverticula) in intestines
column3: Abdominal pain (usually left lower quadrant), fever, nausea, vomiting, constipation/diarrhea
column4: Antibiotics, liquid diet, pain relievers, surgery for severe/complicated cases
column5: High-fiber diet, adequate fluids, regular exercise
column6: Severe abdominal pain, fever >100.4°F, vomiting, rectal bleeding

column2: Form of inflammatory arthritis characterized by recurrent attacks
column3: Sudden severe joint pain (often big toe), swelling, redness, warmth, lingering discomfort
column4: NSAIDs, colchicine, corticosteroids, uric-acid lowering medications
column5: Limit alcohol, maintain healthy weight, limit purine-rich foods
column6: Sudden intense joint pain, especially with fever; recurrent attacks

column2: Viral infection causing painful rash, caused by varicella-zoster virus
column3: Pain/tingling/itching followed by rash with fluid-filled blisters, fever, headache, fatigue
column4: Antiviral medications (acyclovir, valacyclovir), pain relievers, calamine lotion
column5: Shingles vaccine (Shingrix), avoid contact with susceptible people
column6: Rash near eye, severe pain, widespread rash, immunocompromised

column2: Disease
column3: Autoimmune disorder triggered by gluten consumption
column4: Diarrhea, bloating, gas, abdominal pain, weight loss, fatigue, anemia, dermatitis herpetiformis
column5: Strict gluten-free diet, nutritional supplements
column6: No known prevention; early diagnosis and treatment prevent complications
column7: Chronic diarrhea, unexplained weight loss, abdominal pain

column2: Sclerosis
column3: Autoimmune disease where immune system attacks protective covering of nerves
column4: Numbness/weakness in limbs, electric-shock sensations, tremor, fatigue, vision problems
column5: Disease-modifying therapies, corticosteroids, physical therapy, symptom management
column6: No known prevention; vitamin D supplementation may help
column7: Vision loss, paralysis, numbness, coordination problems

column2: Disease
column3: Progressive nervous system disorder affecting movement
column4: Tremor, slowed movement, rigid muscles, impaired posture/balance, speech/writing changes
column5: Levodopa, dopamine agonists, MAO-B inhibitors, deep brain stimulation, physical therapy
column6: No known prevention; some evidence suggests caffeine and regular exercise may reduce risk
column7: Tremor, slowed movement, balance problems

column2: Disease
column3: Tick-borne illness caused by Borrelia burgdorferi bacteria
column4: Bull's-eye rash, fever, chills, fatigue, body aches, headache, neck stiffness
column5: Antibiotics (doxycycline, amoxicillin, ceftriaxone)
column6: Tick avoidance, protective clothing, tick checks after outdoor activities
column7: Bull's-eye rash, flu-like symptoms after tick bite

column2: Disorder where tissue similar to uterine lining grows outside uterus
column3: Pelvic pain, painful periods, pain with intercourse, infertility, heavy periods
column4: Pain medications, hormone therapy, conservative surgery, hysterectomy
column5: No known prevention; early diagnosis may prevent complications
column6: Severe menstrual cramps, chronic pelvic pain, infertility

column2: Group of eye conditions damaging optic nerve
column3: Gradual peripheral vision loss, tunnel vision, eye pain, headache, halos around lights
column4: Eye drops, oral medications, laser treatment, surgery
column5: Regular eye exams, eye protection, control blood pressure/diabetes
column6: Sudden eye pain, headache, blurred vision, halos

column2: Viral infection often caused by Epstein-Barr virus
column3: Fatigue, sore throat, fever, swollen lymph nodes, rash, enlarged spleen
column4: Rest, fluids, pain relievers, avoid contact sports (due to spleen enlargement)
column5: Avoid sharing drinks/utensils, good hand hygiene
column6: Difficulty breathing/swallowing, severe abdominal pain

column2: Disorder
column3: Anxiety disorder characterized by recurrent unexpected panic attacks
column4: Sudden episodes of intense fear, palpitations, sweating, trembling, shortness of breath
column5: Cognitive behavioral therapy, SSRIs, SNRIs, benzodiazepines
column6: Stress management, regular exercise, avoid stimulants, early treatment
column7: Frequent panic attacks, fear of having attacks

column2: Bone disease developing when bone mineral density and mass decrease
column3: Often asymptomatic until fracture occurs; back pain, loss of height, stooped posture
column4: Bisphosphonates, denosumab, teriparatide, hormone-related therapy
column5: Calcium/vitamin D, weight-bearing exercise, no smoking, limit alcohol
column6: Fracture from minor injury, height loss, back pain

column2: Functional gastrointestinal disorder affecting large intestine
column3: Abdominal pain/cramping, bloating, gas, diarrhea, constipation (or alternating)
column4: Dietary changes (low FODMAP), fiber supplements, medications, stress management
column5: Identify and avoid trigger foods, stress management, regular exercise
column6: Rectal bleeding, unexplained weight loss, persistent pain

column2: Infectious disease mainly affecting lungs
column3: Persistent cough (sometimes bloody), chest pain, fatigue, fever, night sweats, weight loss
column4: Multiple antibiotics for 6-9 months (isoniazid, rifampin, ethambutol, pyrazinamide)
column5: BCG vaccine, avoid close contact with active TB, treatment of latent TB
column6: Persistent cough >3 weeks, coughing blood, night sweats

column2: B
column3: Viral infection causing liver inflammation
column4: Fatigue, abdominal pain, jaundice, dark urine, joint pain, loss of appetite
column5: Antiviral medications (tenofovir, entecavir), interferon injections, liver transplant
column6: Hepatitis B vaccine, safe sex practices, don't share needles
column7: Jaundice, severe abdominal pain, persistent fatigue

column2: Apnea
column3: Serious sleep disorder where breathing repeatedly stops and starts
column4: Loud snoring, episodes of stopped breathing, gasping for air, daytime sleepiness, morning headache
column5: CPAP machine, oral appliances, lifestyle changes, surgery
column6: Weight management, avoid alcohol/sedatives, sleep on side, treat nasal congestion
column7: Loud snoring with breathing pauses, excessive daytime sleepiness

column2: Chronic skin condition causing facial redness and visible blood vessels
column3: Facial redness, swollen red bumps, eye problems, thickened skin (especially nose)
column4: Topical medications (metronidazole, azelaic acid), oral antibiotics, laser therapy
column5: Identify and avoid triggers (sun, stress, spicy foods, alcohol), gentle skin care
column6: Persistent facial redness, acne-like bumps, eye irritation

column2: Poisoning
column3: Illness caused by consuming contaminated food or beverages
column4: Nausea, vomiting, watery/diarrhea, abdominal pain/cramps, fever
column5: Rest, fluids, bland diet, antibiotics only for specific bacterial causes
column6: Proper food handling/cooking, hand washing, avoid cross-contamination
column7: Blood in stool, high fever, dehydration, symptoms lasting >3 days

column2: Highly contagious viral infection causing itchy blister-like rash
column3: Fever, loss of appetite, headache, tiredness, itchy blister rash that scabs over
column4: Calamine lotion, antihistamines, acetaminophen, antiviral drugs in some cases
column5: Vaccination, avoid contact with infected persons
column6: Difficulty breathing, confusion, severe headache, rash with pus

column2: Highly contagious viral illness that can be serious for small children
column3: Fever, dry cough, runny nose, sore throat, inflamed eyes, skin rash
column4: Rest, fluids, fever reducers, vitamin A supplementation
column5: MMR vaccine, avoid contact with infected persons
column6: High fever, ear infection, pneumonia, encephalitis

column2: Viral infection affecting salivary glands
column3: Swollen salivary glands, fever, headache, muscle aches, weakness, loss of appetite
column4: Rest, fluids, pain relievers, cold or warm compresses for swollen glands
column5: MMR vaccine, avoid contact with infected persons
column6: Severe headache, stiff neck, testicular pain/swelling, abdominal pain

column2: Contagious viral infection best known by its distinctive red rash
column3: Mild fever, headache, stuffy/runny nose, red eyes, rash, swollen lymph nodes
column4: Rest, fluids, acetaminophen for fever
column5: MMR vaccine, avoid contact with infected persons
column6: Pregnancy with possible exposure, high fever, severe headache

column2: Serious bacterial infection causing painful muscle stiffness
column3: Jaw cramping, muscle spasms, trouble swallowing, seizures, headache, fever
column4: Wound care, tetanus immune globulin, antibiotics, muscle relaxers, ventilator support
column5: Tetanus vaccination (DTaP, Tdap, Td), proper wound care
column6: Any puncture wound or deep cut, especially if contaminated

column2: Cough
column3: Highly contagious respiratory tract infection
column4: Runny nose, mild cough, fever, severe coughing fits that end with whooping sound
column5: Antibiotics (early), supportive care, hospitalization for severe cases
column6: DTaP/Tdap vaccination, avoid contact with infected persons
column7: Bluish skin color, breathing difficulties, dehydration, seizures

column2: Viral infection that can cause warts and lead to various cancers
column3: Often asymptomatic; genital warts, cervical changes, throat warts
column4: Cryotherapy, topical medications, surgical removal, monitoring for cancerous changes
column5: HPV vaccination, safe sex practices, regular Pap tests
column6: Abnormal Pap test, genital warts, known exposure

column2: Viral infection that attacks the immune system
column3: Flu-like symptoms early; later: weight loss, fever, fatigue, recurrent infections
column4: Antiretroviral therapy (ART), treatment of opportunistic infections
column5: Safe sex practices, pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP), don't share needles
column6: Known exposure, persistent flu-like symptoms, opportunistic infections

column2: Mosquito-borne parasitic disease affecting red blood cells
column3: Fever, chills, headache, nausea, vomiting, muscle pain, fatigue
column4: Antimalarial medications (chloroquine, artemisinin-based combination therapy)
column5: Antimalarial drugs when traveling to endemic areas, mosquito avoidance
column6: Fever after travel to malaria-endemic area, severe headache, confusion

column2: Fever
column3: Mosquito-borne viral illness
column4: High fever, severe headache, pain behind eyes, joint/muscle pain, rash
column5: Supportive care (fluids, pain relievers), avoid aspirin and NSAIDs
column6: Mosquito control, protective clothing, mosquito repellent
column7: Severe abdominal pain, persistent vomiting, bleeding gums, fatigue

column2: Virus
column3: Mosquito-borne virus that can cause birth defects
column4: Mild fever, rash, joint pain, red eyes, muscle pain
column5: Rest, fluids, acetaminophen for fever and pain
column6: Mosquito control, protective clothing, avoid travel to endemic areas if pregnant
column7: Pregnancy with possible exposure, Guillain-Barré syndrome symptoms

column2: Bacterial infection causing severe diarrhea and dehydration
column3: Profuse watery diarrhea, vomiting, leg cramps, rapid heart rate, loss of skin elasticity
column4: Oral rehydration solution, intravenous fluids, antibiotics
column5: Safe water and food practices, cholera vaccine for travelers to endemic areas
column6: Severe diarrhea and dehydration, especially after travel to endemic area

column2: Fever
column3: Bacterial infection spread through contaminated food and water
column4: High fever, headache, stomach pain, constipation or diarrhea
column5: Antibiotics (ceftriaxone, azithromycin), fluids
column6: Typhoid vaccine, safe food and water practices, good hygiene
column7: High fever with abdominal pain after travel to endemic area

column2: Fever
column3: Viral hemorrhagic disease spread by mosquitoes
column4: Fever, headache, muscle aches, nausea, vomiting, jaundice
column5: Supportive care (fluids, oxygen, blood pressure support)
column6: Yellow fever vaccination, mosquito control
column7: Fever with jaundice after travel to endemic area

column2: Viral disease transmitted through animal bites
column3: Fever, headache, excess salivation, muscle spasms, paralysis, confusion
column4: Post-exposure prophylaxis (vaccine and immune globulin), supportive care once symptoms appear
column5: Vaccinate pets, avoid contact with wild animals, pre-exposure vaccination for high-risk groups
column6: Animal bite, especially from bat, raccoon, skunk, or fox

column2: Chronic bacterial infection affecting nerves and skin
column3: Discolored skin patches, numbness, muscle weakness, eye problems
column4: Multidrug therapy (dapsone, rifampin, clofazimine)
column5: Avoid close contact with untreated individuals, BCG vaccine offers some protection
column6: Skin patches with loss of sensation, nerve thickening

column2: Serious bacterial infection transmitted by fleas
column3: Sudden fever, chills, headache, swollen/tender lymph nodes (buboes)
column4: Antibiotics (streptomycin, gentamicin, doxycycline)
column5: Avoid rodent-infested areas, flea control, antibiotics after exposure
column6: Fever with swollen lymph nodes after potential exposure

column2: Infectious disease that can attack skin, eyes, lymph nodes, lungs
column3: Fever, skin ulcers, swollen/painful lymph glands, eye inflammation, pneumonia
column4: Antibiotics (streptomycin, gentamicin, doxycycline)
column5: Avoid tick and deer fly bites, wear gloves when handling animals
column6: Fever with skin ulcer or swollen lymph nodes after potential exposure

column2: Bacterial infection spread through water contaminated with animal urine
column3: High fever, headache, chills, muscle aches, vomiting, jaundice, red eyes
column4: Antibiotics (doxycycline, penicillin), supportive care
column5: Avoid contaminated water, protective clothing, doxycycline prophylaxis
column6: Fever with jaundice after exposure to potentially contaminated water

column2: Parasitic disease caused by blood flukes
column3: Rash, fever, chills, cough, muscle aches, abdominal pain, blood in stool/urine
column4: Antiparasitic medication (praziquantel)
column5: Avoid swimming in fresh water in endemic areas, treat water
column6: Blood in urine or stool after travel to endemic area

column2: Parasitic infection transmitted through mosquito bites
column3: Swelling of limbs/genitals, thickened skin, fever
column4: Antiparasitic medications (diethylcarbamazine, ivermectin)
column5: Mosquito control, preventive medication in endemic areas
column6: Lymphedema, especially after travel to endemic area

column2: Parasitic eye and skin disease (river blindness)
column3: Itching, skin changes, eye lesions, vision loss, blindness
column4: Antiparasitic medication (ivermectin)
column5: Avoid black fly bites, ivermectin distribution in endemic areas
column6: Severe itching, skin changes, vision problems after travel to endemic area

column2: Disease
column3: Parasitic infection transmitted by kissing bugs
column4: Swelling at infection site, fever, fatigue, rash, body aches, later: heart/gut problems
column5: Antiparasitic medications (benznidazole, nifurtimox)
column6: Insecticide spraying, improved housing, screening blood donations
column7: Fever with swelling at bite site, heart problems after potential exposure

column2: Sickness
column3: Parasitic disease transmitted by tsetse fly
column4: Fever, headaches, joint pains, itching, later: confusion, poor coordination, sleep disturbances
column5: Antiparasitic medications (pentamidine, suramin, eflornithine)
column6: Avoid tsetse fly bites, protective clothing, insect repellent
column7: Fever with neurological symptoms after travel to endemic Africa

column2: Parasitic disease transmitted by sand fly bites
column3: Skin sores, fever, weight loss, enlarged spleen/liver
column4: Antiparasitic medications (liposomal amphotericin B, miltefosine)
column5: Avoid sand fly bites, protective clothing, insect repellent
column6: Skin ulcers that don't heal, fever after travel to endemic area

column2: Parasitic infection of the intestines
column3: Diarrhea (sometimes bloody), stomach pain, cramping, fever
column4: Antiparasitic medications (metronidazole, paromomycin)
column5: Good hygiene, safe water and food practices, handwashing
column6: Bloody diarrhea, severe abdominal pain, fever

column2: Parasitic intestinal infection
column3: Diarrhea, gas, stomach cramps, nausea, dehydration
column4: Antiparasitic medications (metronidazole, tinidazole)
column5: Good hygiene, safe water practices, handwashing
column6: Persistent diarrhea, dehydration, weight loss

column2: Parasitic sexually transmitted infection
column3: Itching/burning/redness of genitals, discomfort with urination, discharge
column4: Antiparasitic medication (metronidazole, tinidazole)
column5: Safe sex practices, mutual monogamy, condom use
column6: Symptoms of infection, known exposure

column2: Infestation of the skin by the human itch mite
column3: Intense itching, especially at night; rash, burrow tracks
column4: Topical scabicides (permethrin, ivermectin), antihistamines for itching
column5: Avoid direct skin-to-skin contact, treat infected household members
column6: Severe itching with rash, especially at night

column2: Infestation
column3: Infestation of tiny insects on hair or skin
column4: Itching, visible nits (eggs) or lice, irritability, difficulty sleeping
column5: Topical pediculicides (permethrin, malathion), combing, oral ivermectin in severe cases
column6: Avoid head-to-head contact, don't share personal items
column7: Persistent itching, visible lice/nits

column2: Fungal infection of the skin, not caused by worms
column3: Circular rash with clearer skin in middle, itching, redness
column4: Antifungal creams (clotrimazole, miconazole), oral antifungals for severe cases
column5: Keep skin clean/dry, don't share personal items, wear shoes in locker rooms
column6: Widespread infection, no improvement with OTC treatment

column2: Itch
column3: Fungal infection of the groin area
column4: Itching, redness, rash that may have raised edges
column5: Antifungal creams, powders, sprays
column6: Keep groin area clean/dry, wear loose clothing, change underwear daily
column7: Severe infection, spreading, diabetes present

column2: Infection
column3: Fungal infection caused by Candida overgrowth
column4: Vaginal itching/burning, white discharge, pain with urination/sex
column5: Antifungal creams, suppositories, oral fluconazole
column6: Avoid douching, wear cotton underwear, control diabetes
column7: Recurrent infections, severe symptoms, pregnancy

column2: Highly contagious bacterial skin infection
column3: Red sores that rupture, ooze, form honey-colored crusts, itching
column4: Topical or oral antibiotics (mupirocin, cephalexin)
column5: Good hygiene, keep wounds clean, avoid contact with infected persons
column6: Spreading rash, fever, large areas affected

column2: Bacterial infection of the skin and deeper tissues
column3: Redness, swelling, pain, warmth, fever
column4: Oral or intravenous antibiotics, elevation, pain relief
column5: Skin care, treat wounds promptly, control underlying conditions
column6: Spreading redness, fever, rapid heart rate

column2: Bacterial skin infection involving upper dermis and lymphatics
column3: Shiny red swollen area with raised border, fever, chills
column4: Antibiotics (penicillin, erythromycin)
column5: Skin care, treat wounds promptly, control underlying conditions
column6: Sudden onset of painful red skin with fever

column2: Fasciitis
column3: Flesh-eating bacterial infection
column4: Severe pain, redness, swelling, fever, skin discoloration, blisters
column5: Emergency surgery, intravenous antibiotics, supportive care
column6: Good hygiene, proper wound care, control diabetes
column7: Severe pain with skin changes - MEDICAL EMERGENCY

column2: Shock
column3: Syndrome
column4: Rare life-threatening bacterial infection
column5: High fever, rash, low blood pressure, vomiting, diarrhea
column6: Emergency care, antibiotics, IV fluids, supportive care
column7: Proper tampon use, good hygiene, wound care
column8: High fever with rash and low blood pressure - EMERGENCY

column2: Disease
column3: Inflammation of blood vessels in children
column4: Fever lasting >5 days, rash, swollen hands/feet, red eyes/cracked lips
column5: Intravenous immunoglobulin, aspirin, sometimes corticosteroids
column6: No known prevention
column7: Fever in child with rash, red eyes, swollen hands/feet

column2: Purpura
column3: Inflammation of small blood vessels
column4: Purple spots on skin, joint pain, abdominal pain, blood in urine
column5: Supportive care, sometimes corticosteroids, immunosuppressants
column6: No known prevention
column7: Purple skin spots with abdominal pain or joint pain

column2: Inflammatory disease forming granulomas in organs
column3: Fatigue, swollen lymph nodes, weight loss, joint pain, shortness of breath
column4: Corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, sometimes no treatment
column5: No known prevention
column6: Persistent cough, shortness of breath, skin lesions

column2: Rare disease where amyloid proteins build up in organs
column3: Fatigue, weight loss, swelling, shortness of breath, numbness
column4: Chemotherapy, stem cell transplant, supportive care
column5: No known prevention
column6: Unexplained weight loss with multiple organ symptoms

column2: Group of diseases causing hardening/tightening of skin and connective tissues
column3: Hardened skin, Raynaud's phenomenon, digestive problems, joint pain
column4: No cure; treatments for symptoms: immunosuppressants, physical therapy
column5: No known prevention
column6: Skin thickening, Raynaud's phenomenon, digestive issues

column2: Inflammatory muscle disease causing muscle weakness
column3: Muscle weakness (especially hips/thighs/shoulders), fatigue, difficulty swallowing
column4: Corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, physical therapy
column5: No known prevention
column6: Progressive muscle weakness, difficulty swallowing

column2: Inflammatory muscle disease with skin rash
column3: Muscle weakness, skin rash (especially on face/hands), fatigue
column4: Corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, physical therapy
column5: No known prevention
column6: Muscle weakness with characteristic skin rash

column2: Inflammation of blood vessels
column3: Fever, fatigue, weight loss, muscle/joint pain, nerve problems
column4: Corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, sometimes no treatment
column5: No known prevention
column6: Unexplained fever with rash or nerve symptoms

column2: Disease
column3: Rare disorder causing blood vessel inflammation
column4: Mouth sores, genital sores, eye inflammation, skin lesions
column5: Corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, colchicine
column6: No known prevention
column7: Recurrent mouth and genital sores with eye inflammation

column2: Granulomatosis
column3: Inflammation of blood vessels in respiratory tract/kidneys
column4: Sinus pain, nosebleeds, shortness of breath, cough, kidney problems
column5: Corticosteroids, cyclophosphamide, rituximab
column6: No known prevention
column7: Persistent sinus/nasal symptoms with kidney or lung problems

column2: Arteritis
column3: Inflammation of temporal arteries
column4: Headache, jaw pain with chewing, vision problems, fever
column5: High-dose corticosteroids
column6: No known prevention
column7: New headache with vision changes or jaw pain - URGENT

column2: Rheumatica
column3: Inflammatory disorder causing muscle pain/stiffness
column4: Pain/stiffness in shoulders/hips/neck, fever, fatigue
column5: Corticosteroids
column6: No known prevention
column7: Morning stiffness in shoulders/hips/neck

column2: Disorder characterized by widespread pain
column3: Widespread pain, fatigue, sleep problems, memory issues
column4: Pain medications, antidepressants, anticonvulsants, therapy
column5: Stress management, regular exercise, good sleep habits
column6: Widespread pain with fatigue and sleep problems

column2: Fatigue
column3: Syndrome
column4: Complex disorder causing extreme fatigue
column5: Severe fatigue not improved by rest, post-exertional malaise, sleep problems
column6: Symptom management: cognitive behavioral therapy, graded exercise
column7: No known prevention
column8: Persistent severe fatigue affecting daily activities

column2: Autoimmune disease where immune system attacks body's tissues
column3: Butterfly-shaped facial rash, joint pain, fever, fatigue, sun sensitivity
column4: NSAIDs, antimalarials, corticosteroids, immunosuppressants
column5: Sun protection, healthy lifestyle, regular medical care
column6: Butterfly rash, joint pain with fever and fatigue

column2: Gravis
column3: Chronic autoimmune neuromuscular disease
column4: Muscle weakness that improves with rest, drooping eyelids, double vision
column5: Acetylcholinesterase inhibitors, immunosuppressants, thymectomy
column6: No known prevention
column7: Muscle weakness that worsens with activity, drooping eyelids

column2: Syndrome
column3: Rare disorder where immune system attacks nerves
column4: Muscle weakness starting in legs and spreading, tingling, difficulty breathing
column5: Plasmapheresis, IV immunoglobulin, supportive care
column6: No known prevention
column7: Progressive muscle weakness, especially after infection

column2: Progressive neurodegenerative disease affecting nerve cells
column3: Muscle weakness, twitching, stiffness, difficulty speaking/swallowing
column4: Riluzole, edaravone, supportive care, physical therapy
column5: No known prevention
column6: Progressive muscle weakness, especially with speech/swallowing problems

column2: Disease
column3: Inherited disorder causing nerve cell breakdown
column4: Uncontrolled movements, cognitive problems, psychiatric disorders
column5: No cure; medications to manage symptoms (tetrabenazine), therapy
column6: No prevention; genetic counseling recommended
column7: Involuntary movements, cognitive decline, mood changes
